name: Salsa Ninety Nine (Mild)
author: YABEI
summary: A salsa recipe for those with a tomato and pepper garden.  If you prefer a hotter salsa, add more jalapeno or cayenne pepper.
directions: Remove the tomato seeds and pulp
Put seeds and pulp through a food mill
Chop the outsides of the tomatoes In a large pot over low heat, boil the milled liquid and tomato paste  for 1 hour, or until the liquid is reduced by 1/3
In a blender or food processor, puree cilantro, jalapeno, garlic and 1/2 cup of the tomato liquid from the large pot
Slowly stir this mixture into the pot
Bring the contents of the pot to a boil while mixing in the green peppers, onions, chopped tomatoes, salt, vinegar and brown sugar
In a small bowl, dissolve the cornstarch in water
Add the cornstarch mixture to the pot
Stirring continually, boil the mixture until all the vegetable are soft  -- about 30 minutes
Allow the mixture to cool, and place it in sterile containers
